Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: உடையார்முன் இல்லார்போல் ஏக்கற்றுங் கற்றார் கடையரே கல்லா தவர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: With soul submiss they stand, as paupers front a rich man's face; Yet learned men are first; th'unlearned stand in lowest place.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A learned scholar ('கற்றார்') is shown humbly bowing before a great master, eagerly seeking more knowledge, much like a poor person ('இல்லார்போல்') before a wealthy one.
Layered_Composition.Midground: In contrast, an arrogant unlearned person ('கல்லாதவர்') stands with their back turned, arms crossed, refusing to learn. A subtle shadow of ignorance looms over them.
Layered_Composition.Background: A grand stairway leading up to a radiant temple of knowledge. The humble scholar is at the first step, ready to ascend. The unlearned person is at the very bottom ('கடையர்'), refusing to even begin the climb.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The true learned are those who humbly seek more knowledge, making them the highest among people. The unlearned, in their arrogance, remain the lowest.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The humble posture of the scholar symbolizes the humility required for learning. The stairway represents the path of knowledge. The unlearned person's position at the bottom signifies their low status.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Humble, respectful (for the scholar), arrogant, ignorant (for the unlearned), contrasting.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A bright, divine light shines down from the temple of knowledge, illuminating the scholar. The unlearned person is in a dimmer, shadowed area.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Wide shot that clearly shows the contrast in posture and position of the two figures relative to the stairway of knowledge.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with detailed expressions conveying humility and arrogance.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: High-contrast lighting to emphasize the spiritual difference between the two.

Negative_Prompt: arrogant scholar, humble unlearned person, modern setting, text artifacts, blurry.
